question.title: How to make my block (extending to BaseEntityBlock) face to the player when placed?
question.body:
The thing is, I already know how to make a simple block having a single texture on every side, but what i want is a block, like a furnace, which has a front, a top, 3 sides, and a bottom. however, i have no idea if there is a blockstate method to do this.

At First I used blockbench to get a json file for a block model which had different textueres on each side of the block, which is perfect. Afterwards I watched a tutorial where somebody rotated the block which had its own class like e.g. "EnchantingTableBlock" which extended to the class HorizontalDirectionalBlock, but this can't work since my block already has its own class which extends to BaseEntityBlock, and since i can't extend to multiple classes, I have no idea what to do.

The block i am talking about is my ForgeBlock. The block is actually a BlockEntity, so the block also has a ForgeBlockEntity class, but i assume it's irrelevant to my problem. This is the complete class:

public class ForgeBlock extends BaseEntityBlock {
    public static final MapCodec<ForgeBlock> CODEC = simpleCodec(ForgeBlock::new);

    public ForgeBlock(Properties pProperties) {
        super(pProperties);
    }

    @Override
    protected MapCodec<? extends BaseEntityBlock> codec() {
        return CODEC;
    }

    @Override
    public @Nullable BlockEntity newBlockEntity(BlockPos pPos, BlockState pState) {
        return new ForgeBlockEntity(pPos, pState);
    }

    @Override
    protected RenderShape getRenderShape(BlockState pState) {
        return RenderShape.MODEL;
    }

    @Override
    public void onRemove(BlockState pState, Level pLevel, BlockPos pPos, BlockState pNewState, boolean pIsMoving) {
        if (pState.getBlock() != pNewState.getBlock()) {
            BlockEntity blockEntity = pLevel.getBlockEntity(pPos);
            if (blockEntity instanceof ForgeBlockEntity forge) {
                forge.drops();
            }
        }
    }

    @Override
    protected ItemInteractionResult useItemOn(ItemStack pStack, BlockState pState, Level pLevel, BlockPos pPos, Player pPlayer, InteractionHand pHand, BlockHitResult pHitResult) {
        if (!pLevel.isClientSide) {
            BlockEntity entity = pLevel.getBlockEntity(pPos);
            if (entity instanceof ForgeBlockEntity forge) {
                ((ServerPlayer) pPlayer).openMenu(new SimpleMenuProvider(forge, Component.literal("Forge")), pPos);
            } else {
                throw new IllegalStateException("Our Container provider is missing!");
            }
        }
        return ItemInteractionResult.sidedSuccess(pLevel.isClientSide);
    }

    @Override
    @Nullable
    public <T extends BlockEntity> BlockEntityTicker<T> getTicker(Level pLevel, BlockState pState, BlockEntityType<T> pBlockEntityType) {
        if (pLevel.isClientSide) {
            return null;
        }

        return createTickerHelper(pBlockEntityType, ModBlockEntities.FORGE_BE.get(),
                (level, blockPos, blockState, forge) -> forge.tick(level, blockPos, blockState));
    }
}
